an anti-D injection at around 
28-30 weeks as well as after 
the birth  of their baby. This will 
only be required if the baby has 
a rhesus positive blood group.
Anaemia
Anaemia makes you tired and 
less able to cope with any loss 
of blood when you give birth. If 
tests show you are anaemic, you 
will	be	offered	iron	tablets	and	an	
iron rich diet is recommended.
Immunity to rubella 
(German	measles)
Since rubella infection in early 
pregnancy can seriously 
damage your unbo
